Description: Large reconstructed North Ionian black-figured bowl, partly preserved in some 25 fragments, some with other letters of the 1888,0601.540 sequence (d, f, g and illegible); turn of foot partly preserved, diameter 6 cm at join with wall; handles lost. Interior misfired, largely glazed with six added red bands lined in white; small tondo with part of a bud preserved. Exterior slipped cream; frieze of short verticals at lip; in handle zone black-figure animal friezes, one largely lost (rear of lion to left), the other with stag to left between lions; restrained filling ornament; between handle roots hanging lotus-palmette and to either sided spirals with florals. Friezes below separated by black bands with added red band lined in white: stopt maeander; lotus-palmette and bud frieze with double linking tendrils; stopt maeander; rays; black band at foot.
Curator's comments: Very close in style to the bowl 1888,0601.531, with dedication to Aphrodite in Naukratis. Some sherds were re-registered in error as 1924,0222.1037, 1039 and 1044.
Bibliographic references: Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1008, pl. 124) (She gives 1888,0601.535 as the registration number, which is certainly wrong.)
